level.text: The agency shall notify each applicant of its decision to accept or deny his or her application to be a foster parent within thirty (30) days of its receipt.
A foster home shall be re-evaluated two (2) years after the date of the initial approval and every two (2) years thereafter.
If the initial foster home study was performed by the same child-placing agency, the foster home re-evaluation shall include:
Face-to-face interviews with each member of the household;
Updated medical reports on all members of the household; and
Any changes from the initial foster home study.
If the initial foster home study was performed by a different child-placing agency, the child-placing agency’s re-evaluation shall include the following:
Two visits with the foster parent(s), one of which shall be in the home;
Face-to-face interviews with each member of the household;
Updated medical reports on the members of the household; and
Any changes in the family’s data from the initial home study.

level.heading: EDITOR’S NOTE
level.text: This section does not apply to foster homes to which Chapter 60 of this title applies. See 29 DCMR 6000.3.
